entry.title: YOlO-V5 and V8 on pavement defect detection
entry.content:
Scope

As the industry is transforming towards ML-based asset management leveraging computer vision and machine learning algorithms, I trained a YOLO model to
pickup defects from a road pavement.

The database RDD https://github.com/sekilab/RoadDamageDetector?tab=readme-ov-file was used

I compared the performance of Yolo-V5 and Yolo-V8. The Yolo-V5s and V8s were selected

Findings

Yolo-V5 picks up more false positivies than V8
Howeer, the differencs between the two models are minor, and both could serve the purposes in for practical application,

entry.title: Website's scope
entry.content:
The pupose of this website is to provide a summary of the research projects that I have worked on from my PhD and research assistant activity; it will mainly be targeted for
academic recruiter

It will contain these categories

Research
GPT 4 Turbo + Langchain (methodology framework; output generated GPT)
Kerb and channel inspection using Gopro (experiment set-up)
Yolo on pavement crack (performance video)
Data-driven IRI (R-squared data plot)
crowdsourcing (videos, images, performance improvement)
App evaluations (App interfaces, experimenct video, performance plot)
vibration test videos (videos of the vibration test)
Review study (graphical abstract)

Teaching
Course “AI in infrastructure health monitoring” (materials on github)
Tutor (CIV***)
Tutor (CIV***)

Engineering
Civil engineering (iamges of the rendering of the designed projects)
Structural engineering (images of rendering of the designed projects)
Map of the jobs worked on shown on Google map

Volunteering
MElbourne GStep
ACES

Publications
Journal
conference
Thesis

Resume
